div.h3: We Welcome You To The Beatrice Mayes Institute (BMI).
div.p: Since 1966, we have worked diligently to serve the needs of the children within the Houston community by providing the best educational opportunities to ensure personal and professional success. Throughout the years, we have seen generations of students prosper in diverse paths they have chosen for themselves. We instill in our students that with dedication and willingness to persevere throughout the obstacles that may be presented in their journeys to greatness, they can accomplish any goal that they work diligently towards achieving.

Students can achieve whichever goal they have in mind, and it is our duty to help them to become the best versions of themselves so they can inspire their closest loved ones, their peers, and members of their respective communities to make a significant impact on the world and change it for the better.
Teach the children so it will not be necessary to teach the adults.

div.p: Many differences set us apart from other institutions. We are proud of being the oldest lasting African American founded school in Houston. We will continue to serve the community by providing children the best resources and access to an education that will propel them to be individuals who will create an impact in a variety of ways. We are shaping minds and instilling onto students confidence, strong morals and character, creativity, and outstanding leadership skills that will influence society in the most positive of ways. We are very proud of being an institution that provides a rigorous academic curriculum, rivaling magnet and vanguard programs. We expect our students to strive for excellence at every subject that is being presented. We hope our students defy any limited expectations that society has placed on them. We are an institution that works tirelessly to provide a welcoming and nurturing environment to help students achieve the goals that were given by the educators and administrators of the Beatrice Mayes Institute.

div.h3: Beatrice Mayes Institute to suspend normal operations through May 4th
div.p: Beatrice Mayes Institute will continue our distance learning program through at least May 4. We as a community are working together to adhere to Governor Greg Abbott’s executive order announced today. I encourage every family of BMI to remain safe and work as diligently as possible to actively engage with the online assignments.

Please be assured that as we move forward, we will continue to keep our staff and families updated as additional information becomes available. We know we are facing many unknowns, but we are making all decisions with our students, staff and families in mind.
I truly appreciate the patience and cooperation that all our families have exhibited with us. We are resilient, rest assured that we will make it through this ordeal.
